result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse E. Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Submit to psychological assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling and/or education programming directed by the agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse E. Shields in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def states he doesn't want counsel; wants to waive his right to counsel and proceed without counsel.  Court provides def with waiver of counsel and plea waiver forms; matter adjourned.

Matter recalled.  Counsel waiver and plea waiver forms presented to the Court.  Court colloquies on both.  Def pleads no contest.  Finding of guilty.  ADA addresses the Court; asks for 1 year probation.  Def addresses the Court.  Court orders 1 year probation with p. asst and counseling as directed by the agent.
NO CONTACT PROVISON HAS BEEN DROPPED. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse E. Shields in court w/o counsel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court states charges/max possible penalties as well as right to counsel. Court will adjourn hearing to allow def. time to contact SPD and review the complaint. Victim has requested no contact provision be dropped. DA does not object. No contact provision is dropped from the bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
